results.title: P2X3 and P2X2/3 receptors activation induces articular hyperalgesia by an indirect sensitization of the primary afferent nociceptor in the rats' knee joint.
results.text_hl: The non-selective P2X3 and P2X2/3 receptors agonist @CHEMICAL_alpha_beta_methyleneadenosine_5'_triphosphate @CHEMICAL_MESH:C002630 @@@alphabeta-meATP@@@ induced a dose-dependent @<m>DISEASE_Hyperalgesia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006930 @@@articular hyperalgesia@@@, which was significantly reduced by the selective antagonists for P2X3 and P2X2/3 receptors (@CHEMICAL_A_317491 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C470346 @@@A-317491@@@), bradykinin B1- (DALBK) or B2-receptors (@CHEMICAL_bradyzide @CHEMICAL_MESH:C406475 @@@bradyzide@@@), @GENE_UGT1A1 @GENE_24861 @@@beta1-@@@(@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@) or beta2-adrenoceptors (@CHEMICAL_ICI_118551 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C026777 @@@ICI-118,551@@@), by the pre-treatment with cyclooxygenase inhibitor (@CHEMICAL_Indomethacin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007213 @@@indomethacin@@@) or with the nonspecific selectin inhibitor (@CHEMICAL_fucoidan @CHEMICAL_MESH:C007789 @@@Fucoidan@@@).

citations.NLM: Teixeira JM, Parada CA, Tambeli CH. P2X3 and P2X2/3 receptors activation induces articular hyperalgesia by an indirect sensitization of the primary afferent nociceptor in the rats' knee joint. Eur J Pharmacol. 2020 Jul 15;879():173054. PMID: 32145326
citations.BibTeX: @article{32145326, title={P2X3 and P2X2/3 receptors activation induces articular hyperalgesia by an indirect sensitization of the primary afferent nociceptor in the rats' knee joint.}, author={Teixeira JM and Parada CA and Tambeli CH}, journal={Eur J Pharmacol}, volume={879}, pages={173054}}

results.title: Atenolol Reduces Leishmania major-Induced Hyperalgesia and TNF-alpha Without Affecting IL-1beta or Keratinocyte Derived Chemokines (KC)
results.text_hl: We demonstrate here that @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ reduces @<m>DISEASE_Hyperalgesia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006930 @@@peripheral hyperalgesia@@@ but has no significant effect on central @<m>DISEASE_Hyperalgesia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006930 @@@hyperalgesia@@@.

citations.NLM: Karam MC, Merckbawi R, Salman S, Mobasheri A. Atenolol Reduces Leishmania major-Induced Hyperalgesia and TNF-alpha Without Affecting IL-1beta or Keratinocyte Derived Chemokines (KC) Front Pharmacol. 2016;7():22. PMID: 26913003
citations.BibTeX: @article{26913003, title={Atenolol Reduces Leishmania major-Induced Hyperalgesia and TNF-alpha Without Affecting IL-1beta or Keratinocyte Derived Chemokines (KC)}, author={Karam MC and Merckbawi R and Salman S and Mobasheri A}, journal={Front Pharmacol}, volume={7}, pages={22}}

results.title: PHARMACOLOGIC TREATMENT OF HYPERALGESIA EXPERIMENTALLY INDUCED BY NUCLEUS PULPOSUS
results.text_hl: Combined use of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Indomethacin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007213 @@@indomethacin@@@ presented a greater reduction of @<m>DISEASE_Hyperalgesia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006930 @@@hyperalgesia@@@ than did the separate administration of these drugs.

citations.NLM: de Souza Grava AL, Ferrari LF, Parada CA, Defino HL. PHARMACOLOGIC TREATMENT OF HYPERALGESIA EXPERIMENTALLY INDUCED BY NUCLEUS PULPOSUS Rev Bras Ortop. 2010 Nov-Dec;45(6):569-76. PMID: 27026966
citations.BibTeX: @article{27026966, title={PHARMACOLOGIC TREATMENT OF HYPERALGESIA EXPERIMENTALLY INDUCED BY NUCLEUS PULPOSUS}, author={de Souza Grava AL and Ferrari LF and Parada CA and Defino HL}, journal={Rev Bras Ortop}, volume={45}, number={6}, pages={569-76}}

results.title: Interleukin-8 as a mediator of sympathetic pain.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Carrageenan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002351 @@@Carrageenin@@@-evoked @<m>DISEASE_Hyperalgesia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006930 @@@hyperalgesia@@@ was attenuated by @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Indomethacin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007213 @@@indomethacin@@@ and anti-IL-8 serum.

citations.NLM: Cunha FQ, Lorenzetti BB, Poole S, Ferreira SH. Interleukin-8 as a mediator of sympathetic pain. Br J Pharmacol. 1991 Nov;104(3):765-7. PMID: 1797337
citations.BibTeX: @article{1797337, title={Interleukin-8 as a mediator of sympathetic pain.}, author={Cunha FQ and Lorenzetti BB and Poole S and Ferreira SH}, journal={Br J Pharmacol}, volume={104}, number={3}, pages={765-7}}

results.title: Muscle hyperalgesia induced by peripheral P2X3 receptors is modulated by inflammatory mediators.
results.text_hl: @<m>DISEASE_Hyperalgesia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006930 @@@Muscle hyperalgesia@@@ induced by peripheral P2X3 receptors is modulated by @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ mediators.

citations.NLM: Schiavuzzo JG, Teixeira JM, Melo B, da Silva dos Santos DF, Jorge CO, Oliveira-Fusaro MC, Parada CA. Muscle hyperalgesia induced by peripheral P2X3 receptors is modulated by inflammatory mediators. Neuroscience. 2015 Jan 29;285():24-33. PMID: 25446353
citations.BibTeX: @article{25446353, title={Muscle hyperalgesia induced by peripheral P2X3 receptors is modulated by inflammatory mediators.}, author={Schiavuzzo JG and Teixeira JM and Melo B and da Silva dos Santos DF and Jorge CO and Oliveira-Fusaro MC and Parada CA}, journal={Neuroscience}, volume={285}, pages={24-33}}

results.title: Hyperalgesia induced by Asp49 and Lys49 phospholipases A2 from Bothrops asper snake venom: pharmacological mediation and molecular determinants.
results.text_hl: Pretreatment with @CHEMICAL_Guanethidine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006145 @@@guanethidine@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Prazosin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011224 @@@prazosin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Yohimbine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015016 @@@yohimbine@@@, inhibitors of sympathomimetic amines, or with @CHEMICAL_Indomethacin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007213 @@@indomethacin@@@, inhibitor of the cyclo-oxygenase pathway, reduced Lys49 PLA(2)-induced @<m>DISEASE_Hyperalgesia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006930 @@@hyperalgesia@@@ without interfering with the nociceptive activity of Asp49 PLA(2).

citations.NLM: Chacur M, Longo I, Picolo G, Gutiérrez JM, Lomonte B, Guerra JL, Teixeira CF, Cury Y. Hyperalgesia induced by Asp49 and Lys49 phospholipases A2 from Bothrops asper snake venom: pharmacological mediation and molecular determinants. Toxicon. 2003 May;41(6):667-78. PMID: 12727271
citations.BibTeX: @article{12727271, title={Hyperalgesia induced by Asp49 and Lys49 phospholipases A2 from Bothrops asper snake venom: pharmacological mediation and molecular determinants.}, author={Chacur M and Longo I and Picolo G and Gutiérrez JM and Lomonte B and Guerra JL and Teixeira CF and Cury Y}, journal={Toxicon}, volume={41}, number={6}, pages={667-78}}

results.title: Mechanisms underlying transient receptor potential ankyrin 1 (TRPA1)-mediated hyperalgesia and edema.
results.text_hl: Finally, a cyclooxygenase inhibitor (@CHEMICAL_Indomethacin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007213 @@@indomethacin@@@, 100 microg/paw), a @GENE_UGT1A1 @GENE_24861 @@@beta1@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, 6 microg/paw) or a @GENE_UGT1A2 @GENE_396527 @@@beta2@@@ (@CHEMICAL_ICI_118551 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C026777 @@@ICI 118, 551@@@, 1.5 microg/paw) adrenoceptor antagonist also significantly reduced @CHEMICAL_allyl_isothiocyanate @CHEMICAL_MESH:C004471 @@@AITC@@@-induced @<m>DISEASE_Hyperalgesia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006930 @@@hyperalgesia@@@ and @DISEASE_Edema @DISEASE_MESH:D004487 @@@edema@@@.

citations.NLM: Perin-Martins A, Teixeira JM, Tambeli CH, Parada CA, Fischer L. Mechanisms underlying transient receptor potential ankyrin 1 (TRPA1)-mediated hyperalgesia and edema. J Peripher Nerv Syst. 2013 Mar;18(1):62-74. PMID: 23521647
citations.BibTeX: @article{23521647, title={Mechanisms underlying transient receptor potential ankyrin 1 (TRPA1)-mediated hyperalgesia and edema.}, author={Perin-Martins A and Teixeira JM and Tambeli CH and Parada CA and Fischer L}, journal={J Peripher Nerv Syst}, volume={18}, number={1}, pages={62-74}}

results.title: Muscle pain induced by static contraction in rats is modulated by peripheral inflammatory mechanisms.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Dexamethasone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003907 @@@Dexamethasone@@@ (glucocorticoid anti-inflammatory agent), DALBK (bradykinin B1 antagonist), @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ (@GENE_ADRB1 @GENE_24925 @@@beta1 adrenoceptor@@@ antagonist), @CHEMICAL_ICI_118551 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C026777 @@@ICI 118,551@@@ (@GENE_ADRB2 @GENE_24176 @@@beta2 adrenoceptor@@@ antagonist), @CHEMICAL_Indomethacin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007213 @@@indomethacin@@@ (cyclooxygenase inhibitor), and @CHEMICAL_fucoidan @CHEMICAL_MESH:C007789 @@@fucoidan@@@ (non-specific selectin inhibitor) all reduced static contraction-induced @<m>DISEASE_Hyperalgesia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006930 @@@muscle hyperalgesia@@@; however, the bradykinin B2 antagonist, @CHEMICAL_bradyzide @CHEMICAL_MESH:C406475 @@@bradyzide@@@, did not have an effect on static contraction-induced @<m>DISEASE_Hyperalgesia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006930 @@@muscle hyperalgesia@@@.

citations.NLM: Santos DFDSD, Melo Aquino B, Jorge CO, Azambuja G, Schiavuzzo JG, Krimon S, Neves JDS, Parada CA, Oliveira-Fusaro MCG. Muscle pain induced by static contraction in rats is modulated by peripheral inflammatory mechanisms. Neuroscience. 2017 Sep 1;358():58-69. PMID: 28673715
citations.BibTeX: @article{28673715, title={Muscle pain induced by static contraction in rats is modulated by peripheral inflammatory mechanisms.}, author={Santos DFDSD and Melo Aquino B and Jorge CO and Azambuja G and Schiavuzzo JG and Krimon S and Neves JDS and Parada CA and Oliveira-Fusaro MCG}, journal={Neuroscience}, volume={358}, pages={58-69}}
